meanings.definition: The act of recording expenses as they are incurred.
meanings.sent1: Expensing helps keep track of money spent.
meanings.sent2: Proper expensing is crucial for financial management.
meanings.sent3: I tried expensing my daily coffee habit, but it didn't work out well.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was a detailed expensing of her monthly budget.
meanings.sent5: The expensing of office supplies was meticulously organized in the spreadsheet.

meanings.definition: To treat an expense as a deduction from income for tax purposes.
meanings.sent1: Small businesses often expense office supplies for tax benefits.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to expense all eligible business costs for tax savings.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to expense his lunch as a business meeting.
meanings.sent4: Expensing travel expenses can sometimes feel like a game of strategy.
meanings.sent5: She decided to expense the conference fee to reduce her taxable income.
